episodeTitle: The Town of the Beginning and the End! Landfall at Loguetown
episodeTitleJapanese: 始まりと終りの町・ローグタウン上陸
episodeTitleRomanized: Hajimari to Owari no Machi - Rōgutaun Jōriku
description: The Straw Hat crew arrives in Loguetown, the town where Gol D. Roger was born and executed. As the crew splits up to gather supplies before entering the Grand Line, Luffy visits the legendary execution platform while Zoro encounters a mysterious Marine who bears an uncanny resemblance to his deceased friend Kuina.

events.title: Arrival at Loguetown
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at Loguetown, the legendary town where the Pirate King Gol D. Roger was born and executed. The crew plans to stock up on supplies before entering the Grand Line.
events.significance: Marks the crew's arrival at the final town in the East Blue before entering the Grand Line. Loguetown is a historically significant location that will introduce major new characters and themes.

quotes.text: This is the town where the Pirate King was born and executed. The town of the beginning and the end.
quotes.speaker: Narrator

events.title: Smoker's Debut
events.description: Marine Captain Smoker is introduced patrolling the streets of Loguetown. He is informed about Luffy's activities in the East Blue and becomes interested in the young pirate.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most important recurring antagonists in the series. Smoker becomes a persistent pursuer of Luffy throughout the story and represents the more honorable side of the Marines.

quotes.text: I've never let a single pirate escape from this town to the Grand Line.
quotes.speaker: Smoker

events.title: Tashigi's Debut
events.description: Marine Ensign Tashigi is introduced as Smoker's subordinate. She is shown to be passionate about swords and has a strong sense of justice.
events.significance: Introduces Tashigi, who will have a significant relationship with Zoro due to her striking resemblance to his deceased friend Kuina. Her presence raises questions and creates emotional conflict for Zoro.

events.title: Smoker vs. Gally
events.description: Smoker encounters and easily defeats the pirate captain Gally and his crew, who were raiding local warehouses. This demonstrates Smoker's power and his Logia-type Devil Fruit abilities.
events.significance: First demonstration of Smoker's combat abilities and his Moku Moku no Mi powers. Establishes him as a formidable opponent and shows that not all pirates entering Loguetown make it to the Grand Line.

events.title: Moku Moku no Mi Demonstration
events.description: Smoker demonstrates his Moku Moku no Mi (Smoke-Smoke Fruit) Devil Fruit powers for the first time, transforming into smoke to capture Gally and his crew effortlessly.
events.significance: First appearance of a Logia-type Devil Fruit user that Luffy will face. Shows a type of Devil Fruit that makes the user nearly invulnerable to physical attacks, establishing a new level of threat.

events.title: Crew Splits Up in Loguetown
events.description: The Straw Hat crew separates to pursue their individual goals in Loguetown. Luffy seeks the execution platform, Zoro looks for new swords, Nami goes shopping, Sanji searches for ingredients, and Usopp seeks equipment.
events.significance: Sets up the various plot threads that will develop throughout the Loguetown Arc. Each crew member's journey reveals their character and desires.

events.title: Smoker Unknowingly Helps Luffy
events.description: Smoker, unaware of Luffy's identity, helps him find the location of Gol D. Roger's execution platform when Luffy asks for directions.
events.significance: Creates dramatic irony as the Marine who vows to catch all pirates unknowingly aids his future target. Demonstrates Smoker's approachable nature despite his tough exterior.

events.title: Luffy Visits the Gold Roger Bar
events.description: Luffy visits the Gold Roger Bar, where the elderly owner Raoul shares his memories of serving Gol D. Roger the night before he set sail for the Grand Line. The bar was renamed in Roger's honor after his execution.
events.significance: Provides a personal connection to the legendary Pirate King and builds the mythology around Roger. Shows how Roger's legacy continues to inspire and influence people.

quotes.text: The night before he set sail for the Grand Line, Gold Roger sat right where you're sitting now.
quotes.speaker: Raoul
quotes.context: Raoul sharing his memory of Roger with Luffy

events.title: Smoker's Flashback: Roger's Execution
events.description: Smoker recalls witnessing Gol D. Roger's execution as a young boy. Roger's final words about leaving his treasure in 'one place' sparked the Great Pirate Era, a moment that deeply affected young Smoker.
events.significance: Shows the iconic moment that started the entire One Piece story from a different perspective. Reveals why Smoker became a Marine and his personal connection to this pivotal historical event. Reinforces Roger's impact on the world.

quotes.text: My fortune is yours for the taking, but you'll have to find it first! I left everything I own in One Piece!
quotes.speaker: Gol D. Roger
quotes.context: Roger's final words before execution that sparked the Great Pirate Era

quotes.text: Wealth, fame, power. The man who had acquired everything in this world, the Pirate King, Gol D. Roger!
quotes.speaker: Narrator

events.title: Zoro Encounters Tashigi at the Sword Shop
events.description: Zoro enters a weapons shop looking for new swords and encounters Tashigi, who is examining swords and demonstrating her knowledge of famous blades. They have a brief interaction about swords.
events.significance: Sets up the relationship between Zoro and Tashigi. Establishes Tashigi's passion for swords and her knowledge, which will create a connection with Zoro.

events.title: Zoro Discovers Tashigi's Resemblance to Kuina
events.description: After Tashigi removes her glasses and Zoro sees her face clearly, he is shocked to discover she bears an uncanny resemblance to his deceased childhood friend Kuina. In his shock, he accidentally steps on and breaks her glasses.
events.significance: Creates immediate emotional tension for Zoro and establishes a complex dynamic between him and Tashigi. This resemblance will affect their interactions throughout the series and represents unresolved grief for Zoro.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's shocked reaction upon seeing Tashigi's face

events.title: Smoker Realizes Luffy's Identity
events.description: After entering the Gold Roger Bar shortly after Luffy leaves, Smoker realizes that the young man he helped earlier was actually Luffy, the pirate he's been searching for. He immediately sets out to capture him.
events.significance: Sets up the chase that will continue in the next episode. Shows Smoker's determination and creates urgency for the upcoming confrontation.

quotes.text: Straw Hat Luffy... So that was him!
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker realizing he just helped his target

quotes.text: My fortune is yours for the taking, but you'll have to find it first! I left everything I own in One Piece!
quotes.speaker: Gol D. Roger
quotes.context: Roger's legendary final words at his execution

quotes.text: I've never let a single pirate escape from this town to the Grand Line.
quotes.speaker: Smoker

quotes.text: This is the town where the Pirate King was born and executed. The town of the beginning and the end.
quotes.speaker: Narrator

quotes.text: The night before he set sail for the Grand Line, Gold Roger sat right where you're sitting now.
quotes.speaker: Raoul
quotes.context: Sharing memories of Roger with Luffy

themes.description: The episode heavily explores Gol D. Roger's legacy and how it continues to shape the world. His execution sparked the Great Pirate Era, and his presence still looms large over Loguetown.
themes.symbolism: The execution platform serves as a symbol of both endings and beginnings - where Roger's life ended but where countless pirate dreams began.

themes.description: Various characters are shown pursuing their destinies - Luffy following in Roger's footsteps, Smoker dedicated to stopping pirates, and the town itself representing a threshold between the known and unknown.
themes.symbolism: Loguetown as the 'Town of the Beginning and the End' represents a liminal space where one chapter ends and another begins.

themes.description: Tashigi's resemblance to Kuina brings up themes of grief and unresolved emotions for Zoro. The episode shows how the past continues to affect the present.
themes.symbolism: Tashigi literally embodies Zoro's painful past, forcing him to confront memories he has tried to move beyond.

mangaDifferences.difference: The encounter between Smoker and Gally is anime-original content and does not appear in the manga.
The Gold Roger Bar and its owner Raoul are anime-original additions not present in the manga.
Extended scenes of the crew shopping and exploring Loguetown are expanded from brief manga panels.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'Believe' by Folder5 as the opening theme song, replacing 'We Are!' which had been used since Episode 1.
Loguetown is the last island in East Blue before the entrance to the Grand Line, making it a significant threshold location in the story.
The episode adapts chapters 96-97 of the manga, beginning the Loguetown Arc.
Tashigi and Kuina share the same voice actress (Junko Noda in Japanese, Monica Rial in English) in all anime adaptations, emphasizing their connection.
Smoker's epithet 'The White Hunter' comes from his smoke-based Devil Fruit powers and his reputation for hunting down pirates.
